newsitem.title: UK: Allied Domecq gains, Cazenove says "buy".
newsitem.headline: Allied Domecq gains, Cazenove says "buy".

text.p: Shares in drinks and food retail group Allied Domecq Plc advanced on Thursday after the company announced a 32 million stg cash disposal and Cazenove made positive comments on the stock.
The shares were 12-1/2p higher at 426p by 0932 GMT, in trade of 2.3 million shares.
Other drinks companies followed suit, boosted by the strength of the dollar.
Grand Metropolitan Plc was up 7p at 456-1/2p whilst Guinness added 2-1/2p to 442-1/2p.
Market sources said analysts at Cazenove had a "buy" note on Allied Domecq today but Cazenove declined to comment.

Earlier, UK pub owner Morland said it had agreed to buy 24 Exchange bar restaurants from Allied Domecq for 32 million stg cash. Another four million stg was agreed upon for the sale of the freehold of two properties to a third party.
